subject: Re: Reminder: Order #SSN1557, how did it go?
description_text:
Hi

I have put these motors on the pro x ultra pedals and when i use them the piston on the accelerator pedal shakes its self out of its thread at both ends of the piston I the this a complete pain as I’m not able to use the motors without this happening I’ve ordered some locktite thread lock, will it be ok to use this or do you have another solution and is this likely going to happen to other components on the pedals please advise as I want to keep the products as other than this issue they are amazing to use.

Thanks Craig

On 10 Jul 2025, at 12:15, SIMSONN <no-reply@loox.io> wrote:

﻿
Hello Craig, We would be grateful if you shared how things look and feel. Your review helps us and the community that supports us, and it only takes a few seconds. ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

conversations.body_text: Hi craig warner,  Please send me a photo of the issue so I can better understand the situation and help you resolve it. Using threadlocker (screw glue) can also help prevent the screws from loosening.

Hi [image0.jpeg]
The black and silver bottom piston detaches at both ends.
Thanks
Craig

Hi craig warner,    I've seen the issue you mentioned. If you use a wrench, the screw should be able to be fully tightened. Alternatively, as suggested in our previous email, you can apply a small amount of thread locker to the inner side of the screw — this will also help prevent any loosening.  If you have any further questions, feel free to reach out anytime.
Hi craig warner,  Using Loctite thread locker is absolutely fine — it's a reliable solution for preventing screws from loosening and can be used with confidence.
